channel.title: Subtitle injection?
channel.description:
Well, usually when I dl a movie and subs, they come in a dvd format (with vob files etc..) But sometimes I dl a movie in .avi format, and I have to manually add the subs. So you have to use programs like VirtualDub and TMPGEnc, but this takes a while to complete. So I was thinking, is there a way to inject the subs into the .vob files? So first I convert the .avi into dvd format, and then somehow inject the subs. Is this possible or not?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Subtitle injection?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

r4ndom1:

no. you can add subtitles to a jpg file cant you? and of course its possible are you saying for some reason this time you won’t be able to swap that 1 for a 0? no. Im not sure if a program is available at the time but you could make one the same way as they do avi to dvd just add the subtitles to the original image.

Except I was talking about movie files, not literal image files.

Read full topic

item.title: Subtitle injection?
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

xxlegitxx:

From my experience, I believe it is impossible, because it’s not like a .psd file; it’s more of a .jpg file, if you get my analogy.

no. you can add subtitles to a jpg file cant you? and of course its possible are you saying for some reason this time you won’t be able to swap that 1 for a 0? no. Im not sure if a program is available at the time but you could make one the same way as they do avi to dvd just add the subtitles to the original image.

Read full topic
